sense.name: The act of dividing or disconnecting.
sense.examples: The separation of church and state is crucial. Separation of races was common in past eras.

sense.name: The distance between two things.
sense.commentary: SEPARATION[+distance] Note: may be metaphorical distance.
sense.examples: We hid in the separation between the walls. The separation between human beings is not that great.

sense.name: The act of sorting one thing from others.
sense.examples: Jesus speaks of the separation of wheat from chaff. Employees focus on the proper separation of mail.

sense.name: The termination of employment.
sense.examples: Marty's separation was finalized yesterday. Separation from a company sometimes brings compensation.

sense.name: (law) the cessation of cohabitation of two marital partners.
sense.examples: Mariam and I have taken a separation. We filed for separation yesterday.
